entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French sample, essample, from Latin exemplum example

def.dt: :a representative part or a single item from a larger whole or group especially when presented for inspection or shown as evidence of quality :specimen
:a finite part of a statistical population whose properties are studied to gain information about the whole
:an excerpt from a musical recording that is used in another artist's recording
:to take a sample of or from
:to judge the quality of by a sample :test sampled his output for defects sample a wine
:to use a segment of (another's musical recording) as part of one's own recording
:serving as an illustration or example sample questions
:a set in which all of the possible outcomes of a statistical experiment are represented as points
